description: Xamarin bindings to the native iOS Agora.io Voice SDK.
releaseNotes:
Overview
iOS Voice SDK supports the following two main scenarios:

Audio Communication
Audio Live Broadcast
Known Issue and Limitation
To use the startAudioMixing API, ensure that the iOS device is >=8.0.
Currently, encryption does not interoperate with the Web SDK (based on Web RTC).
Currently, it does not support the bluetooth on iPhone 8.
v2.0.2(Released Dec. 15th, 2017)
Fixed the ffmpeg symbol conflict;

v2.0(Released Dec. 6th, 2017)
New Function

Updated the following callbacks for audio mixing and sound effect:

Name	Description
rtcEngineMediaEngineDidAudioMixingFinish	Deprecated. Replaced by rtcEngineLocalAudioMixingDidFinish.
rtcEngineDidAudioEffectFinish	Added. Notifies that the local audio effect has stopped.
rtcEngineRemoteAudioMixingDidStart	Added. Notifies that the remote has started the audio mixing.
rtcEngineRemoteAudioMixingDidFinish	Added. Notifies that the remote has stopped the audio mixing.
Supported external audio source in the Communication and Live Broadcast scenario by adding the following APIs:

Name	Description
enableExternalAudioSourceWithSampleRate	Enables external audio source function.
disableExternalAudioSource	Disables external audio source function.
pushExternalAudioFrameRawData	Pushes external audio frame.
Provided a set of Restful APIs to kick out a peer user from the server in the Communication and Live Broadcast scenario. Contact sales-us@agora.io to enable the function if required.

Bug fix

Fixed issues related to audio routing and bluetooth.

origin: https://docs.agora.io/en/2.0.2/product/Voice/Product%20Overview/release_ios_audio
summary: Xamarin Agora iOS SDK lets you use Agora.in-powered audio sessions in apps
title: Xamarin bindings to the native iOS Agora Voice SDK.
